education.title: Computer Science ‚Äî NTNU
education.description: An integrated master's degree at the Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU). I specialized in database systems, search engines and AI, as well as choosing some web development courses. Towards the end I found a passion for NLP, and ended up writing a master's thesis on automatic news summarization. In short: I used GPT before it was cool üòé

consultantProjects.name: Norges Bank
consultantProjects.description: Making a PoC for a time series prediction tool ‚Äî with support for vast ensemble models. The focus is on explainability and ease of use.

consultantProjects.name: Difa
consultantProjects.description: Difa ensures that the Norwegian pharmacies gets a secure and cost-efficient cloud-based industry solution. My responsibilities mostly consisted of developing Python/Bash scripts to automate repetitive processes. We leveraged Jenkins to facilitate scheduled tasks, and Cloud Foundry and BOSH for deploying and monitoring applications and services. I was also responsible for automating the migration of multiple Hashicorp Vault instances into a unified cluster.

consultantProjects.name: Ayfie
consultantProjects.description: I assisted Ayfie in their transformational cloud journey. I contributed to the refactoring of the codebase from .NET Framework to .NET Core. This ultimately lead to improved performance, reduced costs, and laid the groundwork for future development.

internships.name: Capgemini
internships.description: For my "last ever summer internship" I wanted to experience the life of a software consultant. My team and I worked on the development of a digital information center for our customer: Forsvarsbygg. The purpose of the project was to improve the online experience for the tenants of Forsvarsbygg and reduce the number of inquiries to their service center. Following is a quote from the work certificate I got: "Throughout the project Martin has shown to be proficient in the programming languages and frameworks used. The solution delivered by the students provides an excellent foundation for the product that may soon be implemented."

internships.name: Strise
internships.description: This was my first "real" internship and I worked as a front-end developer. Strise aims to revolutionize enterprise software, and I could not have found a better place to start my IT career. I worked part-time alongside my studies until May, and then continued as an intern during summer. My tasks naturally included a lot of bug squashing and refactoring, but also implementing new features and creating internal tools for efficiency. An example is making a Slack bot to add previews for links to the Strise products. You can read about that and more in a blogpost I wrote for Strise at the link below.

certifications.name: Build Deep Learning Models with TensorFlow Skill Path

other.name: NTNU
other.description: I was a student assistant in the course TDT4145: Data Modelling and Database Systems. It was a great joy helping other students professionally. I often ended up spending more time than I was paid for, just for the fun of it.

other.name: NTNU
other.description: I was a mentor for a student with a functional disability in the courses "TMA4145 - Discrete Mathematics", "TDT4113 - Programming Project", "TI√ò4252 - Technology Management" and "TDT4136 - Introduction to Artificial Intelligence".

other.name: Foodora
other.description: I worked as a food delivery cyclist, aka "rider". A combination of execise and money made for a good part-time job alongside my studies.

other.name: Me
other.description: I worked part-time as a bartender and it was a really fun experience. And besides, being good at making drinks is a "surprisingly" useful skill üçª

other.name: Norwegian Army
other.description: I was in the Norwegian Air Defence Battalion for one year; honing self-discipline and communication skills. I'm not allowed to say too much about this one üòã
